tool.name: Depth of Coverage:
tool.command: rgGATKCoverDepth.py -i "$input_file" -n "$out_prefix" --tmp_dir "${__new_file_path__}" -d "$html_file.files_path" -t "$html_file" --flags "$flags" --gatkjar "${GALAXY_DATA_INDEX_DIR}/shared/jars/GenomeAnalysisTK.jar" #if $gSrc.refGenomeSource=="indexed": --refseqfasta "${ filter( lambda x: str( x[0] ) == str( $gSrc.index ), $__app__.tool_data_tables[ 'all_fasta' ].get_fields() )[0][-1] }" #else --refseqfasta "$gSrc.ownFile" #end if #if $minMappingQuality > "": --minMappingQuality "$minMappingQuality" #end if #if $minBaseQuality > '': --minBaseQuality "$minBaseQuality" #end if

param.name: input_file
param.label: Input: bam format short read data in your current history
param.help: If the select list is empty, you need to upload or import some aligned short read data from a shared library

param.name: out_prefix
param.label: Title for the output file - use this remind you what the job was for

param.name: refGenomeSource
param.help: If in doubt, choose built-in and read Picard/Samtools documentation
param.label: Reference genome - none, built-in or from current history?
param.option: No reference - NM tags will NOT be validated (see Picard documentation)
Use a genome (fasta format) from my history

validator.message: No reference sequences are available for the build associated with the selected input data

param.name: ownFile
param.label: Select a reference genome from history

param.name: minMappingQuality
param.label: The minimum mapping quality to include. (Blank for ALL)

param.name: minBaseQuality
param.label: The minimum base quality to include. (Blank for ALL)

param.name: flags
param.help: If in doubt, leave these all alone and read the GATK documentation
param.label: Special Coverage Flags - see GATK documentation before fooling with these please
param.option: Switch CoverageStatistics to base count mode (rather than coverage) for per-every-locus output
Do not print out the table of locus counts for X samples covered to at least Y depth
Do not output any of the per-interval statistics; only the aggregate
Do not output depth of coverage at every base; results in big speedup
Do not output the sample summary table
Indels will be included in coverage and base counts
Sites consisting only of deletions will be entirely ignored (no coverage)

param.name: outputFormat
param.help: If in doubt, choose r-table and read the GATK documentation
param.label: Output file format?

param.name: partitionType
param.help: If in doubt, choose none and read the GATK documentation
param.label: Partition type to calculate coverages (can be multiple levels)?

param.name: summaryCoverageThreshold
param.help: If in doubt, choose none and read the GATK documentation
param.label: Summary files will include a %_bases_covered_to_[VALUE] column?

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Purpose**
Estimate Coverage Depth
Please refer to the GATK documentation at http://www.broadinstitute.org/gsa/wiki/index.php/Base_quality_score_recalibration since that was used as the specification for this Galaxy wrapper. Please let the Galaxy developers know if there are any errors or corrections - we need all the help you can give.
**Why you might want to use this tool**
This tool provides a Galaxy interface to a procedure recommended at for adjusting short read quality scores All your work is securely, sharably and reproducibly persisted in a web app instead of spread all over your laptop/desktop and cellphone.
